title: torch.matmul() behavior doesn't match docs
body_html:
On master, torch.matmul() doesn't accept an out arg, but the docs suggest that it should.

a = torch.LongTensor([3,4])
b = torch.LongTensor([4,5])
c = torch.LongTensor()
torch.matmul(a,b, out=c)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: matmul() got an unexpected keyword argument 'out'
body_text:
On master, torch.matmul() doesn't accept an out arg, but the docs suggest that it should.
a = torch.LongTensor([3,4])
b = torch.LongTensor([4,5])
c = torch.LongTensor()
torch.matmul(a,b, out=c)

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: matmul() got an unexpected keyword argument 'out'
body:
On master, torch.matmul() doesn't accept an out arg, but the docs suggest that it should.

```
a = torch.LongTensor([3,4])
b = torch.LongTensor([4,5])
c = torch.LongTensor()
torch.matmul(a,b, out=c)
```
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: matmul() got an unexpected keyword argument 'out'
```
